Others: Walker Buehler struggled in his start against the Chicago Cubs, allowing five runs on nine hits with a walk over five-plus innings.
Cody Bellinger and Michael Busch, both former Dodgers, contributed to the Cubs' offense with Bellinger hitting a two-run home run and Busch adding a home run and three RBIs.
The Dodgers are looking for a viable No. 2 starter as October approaches, with Yoshinobu Yamamoto expected to return from the injured list.
Since Aug. 14, Buehler is 0-1 with a 6.14 ERA in five starts, with 18 strikeouts in 22 innings, but also allowing 11 walks and five home runs.
Buehler has a 9.69 ERA in the first inning this season, with four home runs allowed.
The Cubs managed to score just two total runs during a three-game series against the New York Yankees this past weekend.
Shohei Ohtani stole his 47th base in the game, inching closer to the first 50-50 season in MLB history.
